comments: For n >= 1 a(n) is the order of the wreath product of the symmetric group S_n and the Abelian group (C_9)^n. - Ahmed Fares (ahmedfares(AT)my-deja.com), May 07 2001a(n) = 9*A035023(n) = product(9*k,k=1..n), n >= 1; a(0) := 1.Pi^n/a(n) is the volume of a 2n-dimensional ball with radius 1/3. - _Peter Luschny_, Jul 24 2012
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..300
Index entries for sequences related to factorial numbers
mathematica: s=1;lst={s};Do[s+=n*s;AppendTo[lst, s], {n, 8, 2*5!, 9}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Nov 08 2008 *)
